data: “I have a presentiment that we shall find in the valley of Biban el Molûk a tomb intact,” said to a high-bred-looking young Englishman a much more humble personage who was wiping, with a big, blue-checked handkerchief, his bald head, on which stood drops of perspiration, just as if it had been made of porous clay and filled with water like a Theban water-jar.

"I have a presentiment that we shall find in the valley of Biban el Molûk a tomb intact," said to a high-bred-looking young Englishman a much more humble personage who was wiping, with a big, blue-checked handkerchief, his bald head, on which stood drops of perspiration, just as if it had been made of porous clay and filled with water like a Theban water-jar.

The Romance of a Mummy and Egypt
The Works of Theophile Gautier, Volume 5
Gautier, Théophile, 1811-1872; Sumichrast, Frederick C. de (Frederick Caesar de), 1845-1933 [Translator]
